text: 19.35 In addition, to minimise potential risk of conflict or collision MOVEMENT AND CONNECTIVITY between users, where possible pedestrian footways and cycle lanes should be clearly designed to be perceived as separate facilities, and mixing pedestrian and cyclist should be avoided. This is particularly important to protect vulnerable road users, for example, those who may not be able to see or hear an approaching cyclist. Best practice guidance such as the DfT Inclusive Mobility Guidance should be followed. 19.36 Part 3(f) requires development proposals to support the uptake of cycling in Tower Hamlets. Safety and perceptions of safety is often cited as a key reason why people choose not to take up cycling, with particular risk from heavy traffic, HGVs, and hostile motorists.
